column5: So I won this the other day on a raffle site, anyone else have this unit?  Likes, dislikes, thoughts? Thanks.
From reading on other sites, a lot of satisfied people.
Your doing alright winning some nice prizes . I will have a camera next year. Or sooner. If they go on sale .
Thanks Mr B.  I will be honest I have spent a few bucks trying for items but YES I am still ahead of the game cost wise.
I have no want for the extra piss off of knowing they are actually down there and not biting!!
My buddy, has one. Works great, he used it on Simcoe and was awesome in seeing how whitefish bite. I would say it's a game changer. You will enjoy it. 👍
I want to know the bottom structure . Sand,mussels and what the hell the clouds of fish are.
scary photo on the monitor.................😉 Doug
How many feet of cord attached to the camera?
It’s awesome for checking the bottom structure.  We used them all winter to see if we where sitting on rock and to see if it was holding gobies.  Worked great!!
This one is 100 feet Shag (aka Doug) no it isn't
MY son got me the same camera for Xmas.  I have not tried it yet in the water.  Looks decent.
I'd love one for fishing deep lakers.   I'd probably be on the camera more then fishing though...
That is my big fear Bill. LOL
Well with my luck and the way the world and weather is going I wont get to test this unit out till the boating season.  But I thank you all that have replied.

They're ok for Lakers if your consistently pulling them off bottom......until you hook one and it wraps the cable 1/2dz times 😄 Ask how I know lol....Better left for smaller, bottom oriented fish and verifying bottom composition IMO Josh
I have one but don't use it a lot. I trust my Raymarine to show me fish and structure. I use it when the fish are off bite and I am bored.
